most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working

common_issues.title: Pieces OS stuck, VS extension not working
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS getting stuck, failing to launch from the system tray, and the VS extension reporting it as not running. This might be due to OS errors during applet hosting. Proposed solutions include updating the VS extension and Pieces OS, and investigating OS error codes.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points:

* Andrea3i reported the OS toolbar in Pieces not launching.
* The Visual Studio plugin and Pieces OS versions were updated, but the issue persisted.
* The problem seems to stem from an OS error occurring when trying to host applets.
* Pieces team is investigating and needs more information from Andrea3i to diagnose the root cause.

### Problems Identified:

* OS toolbar not launching.
* Pieces OS restarts unexpectedly.
* Clicking the system tray icon doesn't do anything.

### Proposed/Implemented Solutions:

* Released Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 to address UI thread hang.
* Scheduled to release Pieces OS version 10.1.15 with changes to how ports are chosen for tool windows.
* Proposed scheduling a meeting with Andrea3i for further debugging.
* Requested running a utility to retrieve the OS error code for diagnosis.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* Issue remains unresolved.
* Investigating the OS error causing the applets not to be hosted.
* Need more information from Andrea3i to determine root cause.

recommendations: **Investigate and resolve the Pieces OS stuck issue:** This appears to be a critical issue affecting users and the Visual Studio extension. Prioritize identifying the root cause and implementing a fix.

**Improve error handling and reporting:** Provide more informative error messages to users and log more detailed error information for debugging. This will help diagnose and resolve issues more efficiently.

**Consider a dedicated troubleshooting guide:** Create a troubleshooting guide for common issues like the Pieces OS stuck problem. This can help users self-resolve problems and reduce support tickets.

**Gather more information from affected users:**  Schedule a meeting with the user (Andrea3i) to gather more details about their system configuration, steps to reproduce the issue, and any relevant error messages.

**Monitor the effectiveness of proposed solutions:** After implementing solutions like the VS plugin update and Pieces OS 10.1.15 release, closely monitor user feedback and support tickets to assess their impact on the reported issues.

**Proactively communicate updates to users:** Keep users informed about the status of the investigation, planned fixes, and estimated resolution timelines. This can help manage expectations and improve user satisfaction.
